1.title: Whizzy Busy Bubbles
1.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon have a long list of chores to do - but they find out a way of speeding things up when Dear Dragon blows some Whizzy Busy Bubbles.

2.title: The Water Ballet
2.plot: The whole Castle is delighted when Splish-Splash the water dragon performs her very own enchanting ballet.

3.title: A Dragon for Rattle
3.plot: Rattle wants his very own dragon - and all of the dragons are keen to fit the bill! Each one of them tries to impress him - but which one will he choose?

4.title: Sky Drawing
4.plot: Zoom-Zoom is a little bit jealous of Dear Dragon and his talent for blowing bubbles - and he wants to be appreciated for the things he can do - so he challenges Dear Dragon to a competition - they are both going to draw pictures in the sky. But who is going to win?

5.title: Trouble in the Maze
5.plot: When Princess Florrie and Dear Dragon are playing next to the maze, Florrie accidentally flings her bubble mix over the hedge. The Maze is very hard to find your way around - and when Rattle and Toot-Toot offer to go in and find it for her, Florrie is worried they will get lost - so she and Dear Dragon go in too... then they are all lost - the problem is, how to find their way out again?

6.title: The Grand Picnic
6.plot: Princess Florrie and Dear Dragon are very excited - it is the day of the Grand Picnic - but Paprika is finding it hard to cope. Florrie thinks that she and Dear Dragon can make all the food - after all two people are better than one... but when the sandwiches are whisked away in a crowd of bubbles, things start going very wrong indeed...

7.title: Ferdinand's Grand Design
7.plot: Ferdinand is making her a wonderful surprise. But what can it be? Will Florrie and Dear Dragon find out what it is?

8.title: Tickley Bubbles
8.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon discover they have created some tickling bubbles which they try out on anyone who needs cheering up but unfortunately its stopped them getting on with their chores.

9.title: Can't Skate, Won't Skate
9.plot: Florrie, Pom 1 and Pom 2 are playing roller tag. Pom 1 accidentally crashes into Rattle and Dear Dragon's block castle. She then gets a fear of falling and no longer wants to skate. But the support from all her friends, gets her back on her feet, and they all perform a dance, including Ferdinand on his skateboard.

10.title: Toot Toot's Surprise Band
10.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon are singing and find Toot-Toot making music. In the kitchen they start playing the pots and pans and then find Casimir who ends up playing the 'bottles' like pan-pipes, they all come together to make a wonderful musical band.

11.title: Queen for a Day
11.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon decide to play dress-up with bubbles, but Florrie gets caught up in playing queen with her bubble cape and dress and starts being so bossy and snooty that no-one wants to play with her.

12.title: Hide and Seek
12.plot: While Florrie and the Dragons play hide and seek, Rattle goes missing completely.

13.title: Oopsey Bubbles
13.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon are having so much fun assembly a new chandelier in the ballroom that they accidentally break it. They put together a new chandelier using decorations gathered from all their friends.

14.title: Bubbles Everywhere
14.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon are helping Paprika tidy Casimir's Room. They come across a magical mirror which ends up causing a bit of trouble for Dear Dragon and Florrie.

15.title: Hat in the Sky
15.plot: Florrie, Dear Dragon and Splish-Splash are doing the laundry. While hanging up the washing on the line, a huge gust of wind blows Paprika's hat away. How are they going to explain to Paprika that her hat is missing? And how is Paprika going to cook without her hat?

16.title: The Soup Melon
16.plot: Paprika is planning on making a wonderful melon soup, but unfortunately Dear Dragon and Florrie break the soup melon while playing in the vegetable garden. Will Florrie and Dear Dragon be able to fix their mistake?

17.title: Hiccups
17.plot: Dear Dragon is concentrating on how to blow a wobble bubble for Florrie, but he gets a fright by an unexpected sound and ends up swallowing the wobble bubble instead. This causes Dear Dragon to get the hiccups. Will his friends be able to help him get rid of his hiccups?

18.title: Get Well Toot-Toot
18.plot: Toot-Toot has caught Dragon Droop and is feeling terribly under the weather. Will Florrie and Dear Dragon and the rest of his friends be able to cheer him up?

19.title: Trumpet Bubbles
19.plot: Its time for Florrie to get a music lesson from Toot-Toot. After looking at so many instruments, Florrie decides to learn how to play the trumpet. But things don't seem to be going the way Florrie thought it would. Will her best friend Dear Dragon be able to help her?

20.title: Bath Time Dear Dragon
20.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon are picking flowers for the Spring Fair. Dear Dragon gets a little muddy and Ferdinand insists that he gets a bath, but Dear Dragon hates baths. How are they going to get him clean in time for the Spring Fair?

21.title: A Very Cherry Mystery
21.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon try to solve the mystery of who's been picking all the cherries off the cherry tree.

22.title: Rattle-less Rattle
22.plot: Florrie and Rattle are playing with bubbles, while Ferdinand is trying to pick a new doorbell. But he can't hear anything with Rattle making so much noise. He then decides to put a little oil on Rattle's joints. This takes away Rattle's rattling altogether.

23.title: Hot Air Balloon
23.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon find a rolled up hot air balloon in Casimir's Room. Casimir decides that they should blow it up and take it for a ride, but Ferdinand feels Florrie is too young to ride on it.

24.title: Explorers
24.plot: Florrie and Dear Dragon are play pretend explorers. With a little help of Casimir's magic and a mysterious Thingamajiggy Box, they are able to go on a real adventure.

25.title: The Pet Snoozle
25.plot: Florrie really wishes to have a pet of her own, but its not so easy keeping a pet. Especially one that causes so much havoc.

26.title: Swish-Splash
26.plot: Splish-Splash is tired of skidding around on land on her slippery feet. Florrie and Dear Dragon want to help Splish-Splash, but things get a little messy.

27.title: The Frog Dragon
27.plot: Dear Dragon wakes up with a cold and a croaky voice. Florrie is sure that Casimir can help by treating Dear Dragon with a spell. But Casimir gets it confused - thinking Dear Dragon wants to be more croaky, so he turns Dear Dragon into a frog. How are they going to fix this little problem now?

28.title: Ferdinand Who?
28.plot: Ferdinand is giving out the orders of jobs to do on his list - starting with spoon sorting, when he slips and bangs his head. From that moment on he can't remember anything - even his own name! Casimir knows that showing somebody something they are familiar with helps bring their memory back, so Florrie and Dear Dragon must find that one special thing to help him remember - do you know what it will be?

29.title: Treasure Hunt
29.plot: Florrie gets a present delivered - but inside there is only a small piece of paper, with a little rhyme on the back - it is a clue - a clue to find some treasure... they work it out, and find another piece of paper! So it goes on until they are led back to the ballroom - but what could the treasure be??

30.title: The Pom Pom Club
30.plot: Pom 1 and Pom 2 have formed their very own club - but they won't let Princess Florrie and Dear Dragon join, saying it is only for Poms.... Florrie is so upset she forms her own club with Dear Dragon - the bubble club. But when the Poms ask Zoom-Zoom to join the competition increases - what will happen when both clubs start asking Toot-Toot to join? Which side will he pick?

31.title: Lockweeds
31.plot: Florrie wants to go flying with Zoom Zoom, but Ferdinand needs her to help pick all the lockweeds - otherwise they will grow around the castle and trap everyone inside! Florrie picks most of them... but the flight is just too tempting, so she leaves without finishing the job properly. During her flight she sees that the whole castle is covered in lockweeds - and she has to find the key.

32.title: The Bad Beard Day
32.plot: Florrie offers to give Casimir a beard cut - and he falls asleep to Toot-Toot's music as she does so... the problem is, Florrie wants to fall asleep too - and accidentally cuts off too much beard! Casimir waves his wand and makes a new beard - but this new beard has a life of its own!

33.title: That's Not Florrie
33.plot: Florrie wants to go flying with Zoom-Zoom, but she has a cough and Paprika tells her she must go to bed - no flying for her today. Dear Dragon wants to read her the story of Red Riding Hood, but Florrie isn't interested - but it does give her an idea. Quick as a flash she swaps places with Dear Dragon, who puts on her nightie and gets into bed to pretend to be her! Will Paprika notice that the real Florrie is on the roof waiting for Zoom-Zoom, and that Dear Dragon isn't Florrie at all?

34.title: A Home for Dear Dragon
34.plot: Dear Dragon decides that he needs to live with other dragons at the Dragon Hills. This makes Florrie very sad. But can the these best friends live apart from on another?

35.title: Zoom-Zoom's Control Room
35.plot: Zoom-Zoom asks Florrie and Dear Dragon to run his control room whilst he goes for a flight. Everything is going well until Florrie leaves Dear Dragon alone to get some drink. Accidentally some juice whizzes up into the sky - right into Zoom Zoom's eyes! Zoom-zoom cant see where his going, how will they get him down again safely?

36.title: The Thingamajiggy Box
36.plot: Casimir's room is full of wonderful surprises - and the Thingymajiggy box is one of the best. He can make great big things appear out of this very little box. When he leaves it with Florrie she can't resist taking the lid off.

37.title: Singing Daisies
37.plot: Every seven years the fireflies are wooed by the song of the singing daisies who fly down to pollinate them ready for the next time. It is a beautiful and magical time. Florrie can't wait - but Toot-Toot has other ideas. He wants the daisies to sing a different song - one he has written. The problem is... the fireflies don't like it!

38.title: Snoozelless in the Snoozelwood
38.plot: Dear Dragon's trumpet bubbles are great fun - until they drift into the Snoozlewood! When they burst they wake up the Snoozles - and they must be put back to sleep! Counting doesn't work, and Casimir tries a spell, but only puts himself to sleep. In the end with the help of Toot-Toot they are able to put the Snoozles to sleep with a lovely lullaby!

39.title: The Dragon Egg
39.plot: When Florrie finds a huge egg shaped stone she is sure it is a dragon egg - so she does everything she can to make it hatch. Dear Dragon isn't so sure - but Florrie is very angry when he tries to say so. He goes off to play with Rattle whilst Florrie looks after the egg... but then she realizes it isn't an egg at all. What could this egg shape be?

40.title: A Rainy Day
40.plot: When it rains it means you have to stay indoors, unless that is you have a Wizard living with you! Casimir shows off his sunbrella - a little web of sunshine to keep you dry. When he goes out he leaves his spell book - and Florrie tries a spell that gets rid of all the clouds. It works! But those naughty clouds start causing trouble!

41.title: Dance Dance Dance
41.plot: It's the Grand Ball and the Poms are teaching Rattle a new dance. Florrie and Dear Dragon want to learn too - but Dear Dragon seems to get his feet all muddled up. That is until Florrie devises a cunning plan to help him learn the moves.

42.title: Float Day
42.plot: Florrie wants to fly - and wants to find a flying spell in Casimir's book... the nearest she can get is a floating spell. For a while it is great fun - and in fact everyone and everything in the castle starts floating around. But then sooner or later everyone wants to get down and Florrie doesn't know what to do!

43.title: Raspberry Jam Volcano
43.plot: Dear Dragon has eaten all the cherry jam - and there are no more cherries to make it with. Casimir remembers they found a raspberry jam volcano when they went exploring - so they set out once again to find it - but when they get there all the jam has set. What can they do?

44.title: Florrie the Hero
44.plot: Florrie reads a book with Dear Dragon all about various heroes and it gets her very excited. She wants to be a hero too! But no matter how much she tries to help people they all seem to be getting on very well without Super-Florrie. It isn't until the end of the day she realizes quite how much help she has been!

45.title: The Bubble Necklace
45.plot: When Florrie borrows Splish-Splash's favourite pearl necklace she has a lovely time playing 'dress up' - but when the elastic breaks and all the pearls scatter she and Dear Dragon have to find them all... then... just as they do... something goes terribly wrong... do you think Splish-Splash will like a necklace made of bubbles?

46.title: Florrie's Portrait
46.plot: Ferdinand must paint Florrie's portrait so it can go into the ballroom alongside Sir Scowling Gloom - but Florrie won't sit still - she doesn't want to have her portrait painted - she wants to play with bubbles. Ferdinand thinks he'll never paint a portrait of her, until he has a very clever idea.

47.title: Disco Bubbles
47.plot: Pom and Pom are playing discos - but Dear Dragon can't join in because he can't dance. He gets the steps all muddled up and then even plays the wrong music. Sad and upset, Dear Dragon leaves the Pom's house, where Florrie stays behind to learn the dance. The Pom's and Florrie then decide on making a grand finale for their dance - which Dear Dragon can then participate in.

48.title: Silly Sports Day
48.plot: Today's the day to play some silly sports and have a silly sports day. Everyone thinks it is a wonderful idea - including Zoom-Zoom, who is convinced he will win everything because he is the best! But as they play the silly games Zoom-Zoom doesn't win everything, and he makes it rain to spoil everyone else's fun. What will happen to silly sports day now?

49.title: The Harpsicouch
49.plot: Once a year Toot-Toot has to tune his magical instruments - but this year the Harpsicouch is proving very tricky - soon it runs out of his hill and causes chaos around the castle and its gardens. Florrie has to be the one to tune and tame it - but how will she do it?

50.title: The Grown-up's Day Off
50.plot: Florrie decides that all the grown-ups are too tired and need a day off - she and the dragons will look after everything. Soon the kitchen and the ballroom are full of busy dragons, but has Florrie had the right idea?

51.title: Roll Up! Roll Up!
51.plot: Ferdinand is at his wits end. He has finally run out of ideas and can't think of anything for the evening's entertainment. Florrie says she and Dear Dragon will help - and they go round the castle to ask for ideas. They meet Paprika juggling with bouncy buns, Casimir practicing his magic, Zoom-Zoom falling along the washing line - but none of them has anything to contribute. Until Florrie has a very clever thought. That night, out of ordinary tasks, she produces the Castle Circus!

52.title: The Winter Ball
52.plot: The Winter Ball is one of the most magical times of year in the castle - with its sparkling tree and its gift socks but this year the socks have been eaten by moths, the lake is frozen and so are Zoom-Zoom's wings! Everyone is very grumpy. Florrie tries to make everybody feel better by bringing them inside to warm up and then the magic begins.
